info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 02 at 7:41PM CDT until July 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG...RANDALL...CARSON AND POTTER COUNTIES... At 740 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Fritch to 6 miles northwest of Washburn to Mescalero Park to 6 miles north of Dawn, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Canyon, Panhandle, Fritch, White Deer, Lake Tanglewood, Buffalo Lake, Bushland, Washburn, Umbarger, Palo Duro Canyon, Mescalero Park, Timbercreek Canyon and Pantex. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
